title: MD
biography: Indian Idol is an Indian Hindi-language singing reality competition on Sony TV. It is an Indian version of the British show Pop Idol and is part of the Indian Idol series. It has aired on Sony Entertainment Television since 2004. Originally produced by Miditech Studios and its iconic producer-brothers, Niret Alva, Nikhil J Alva and Nivedith Alva, the series was an instant success. The brothers produced the first 5 seasons of the series and were instrumental in laying the foundation for its future success.
aiSummary: Rakesh Kakkar is a ncd policy specialist with an H-index of 110 at Public Health Foundation (Faculty). Has been published in The Lancet Diabetes & Endocrinology, Journal of Diabetes Science and Technology. Based in India.
